title: Game Ping, non custom test.
body:
is it reasonably accurate to ping this site or google before a game to see if it works, or is there an actual ip I can have to ping test?
I don't rely on speedtest.net, because it says like 15-20 ping, but its never that when I join a game.

replies.body:
In game ping is pretty tricky - tbh the only way is going to be to load up a custom game and see what your ping is.

The reason this is the most accurate way is because it'll show you what your ping is for actual game traffic. If you do something like 

"ping <some ip address>"

These numbers won't necessarily be 100% accurate because ping commands typically send ICMP packets (which are different than LoL game packets). Since these packets are different, and have different sizes, they maybe be routed differently as they travel through network switches between your location and wherever the game servers are.

Well I dont do that. Due to some reasons of mine:

1) When in game, other players connections may be kinda crappy, so ping / FPS is very inaccurate
2) When in custom (by your-self) all you're doing is measuring your own ping, which means if you go into game, it may dramatically increase or decrease

Those are my main reasons anyway
